chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Stanfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Habitual Criminality], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with Terrance Whitehead or Laura Rud.

The defendant shall cooperate with and participate in any assessments, treatment and/or programming as determined appropriate based on the defendant's assessed risk and criminogenic needs, and as directed by the Department of Corrections.  Comply with CHIPS order.

timeConds.notes: Imposed and stayed on the condition that defendant successfully complete the La Crosse County Treatment Court Program.

If unemployed over 60 days, defendant to perform 60 hours of community service within 30 days.  Thereafter, if unemployed over 120 days defendant must perform 32 hours of community service each week, until he obtains employment of at least 25 hours per week.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 2 and any other probation now serving.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
